parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From apo and erchomai; to go off, aside or behind, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.
A colt, young ass, foal. Apparently a primary word; a 'foal' or 'filly', i.e., a young ass.
Without, outside. Adverb from ek; out(-side, of doors), literally or figuratively.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Prop: a road around anything; the street of a village. From the base of amphoteros and hodos; a fork in the road.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: To bind, tie, fasten; I impel, compel; I declare to be prohibited and unlawful. A primary verb; to bind.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
(a) a door, (b) met: an opportunity. Apparently a primary word; a portal or entrance.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
